intro: Lasiodiscus alluaudii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, thriving in shaded, humid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to deep purple, are pollinated primarily by moths and small bees. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
